name: Butt Joint
description: A Butt Joint is a basic woodworking joint where two pieces of wood are joined by simply butting one piece against another, typically at the end. This joint is commonly used for frame construction and is simple to create, making it a staple in woodworking projects.
operations: Cutting the ends of the pieces to be joined square
Aligning the edges of the pieces
Ensuring proper fit and flush surfaces
